intro: Odontarrhena dudleyi, commonly known as Dudley's odontarrhena, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly found in the Bahamas and Cuba. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
